name: La Mi Venta
address: Plaza de la Marina Española, 7, 28013 Madrid, Spain
review:
Delicious seafood paella and refreshing sangriaI usually don't like sangria, way too sweet in my palate but we trusted our waiter and tried it. Oh my gosh,.... Reseñas en español y ingles:

La Mi Venta is across the street from the National Palace (Palacio Real de Madrid), so it's near a very popular area of the.... Excellent restaurant close to the palace and Plaza de Espana. Come as a partty so you can order some of the larger peices of meat and paella, which serve....

name: Hanan
address: Calle Ventura Rodríguez, 3, 28008 Madrid, Spain
review:
We ordered the vegetarian plate for two persons (37€), and we each had a couple of beers to go with it (which increased our bill to a total of 47€).    The.... On our last night in Madrid, we wanted to try something different as we were tired of Spanish tapas and italian food.
We love Ethiopian food and came here.... Seeing as Yelp has a large American audience, I feel like it's fair that I review this restaurant through the lens of an American.  I'm fully aware of the....

name: El Club Allard
address: Calle de Ferraz, 2, 28008 Madrid, Spain
review: El Club Allard is an elegant restaurant in Madrid that's fairly popular for its Spanish haute cuisine. We made reservations well ahead of our trip, and.... How do you rate a culinary journey that surpasses all expectations and experiences? I can only say that in my opinion, El Club Allard provided an.... El Club Allard is on par with most Michelin restaurants I have been to. We did the 12 course prefix. Price was reasonable. Presentation was aesthetically....

name: Plaza España 9
address: Plaza de España, 9, 28008 Madrid, Spain
review: Best food, best drinks, and all traditional! The owner gave us his back story on why the food is SOOOO good! His brothers cooks and was taught by his mother.... This restaurant does not exist anymore. Building 9 now has a ice cream shop along with a bar next door.. After sightseeing all day we came in for a very late lunch. From reviews I read I wanted to try the mix paella since it's one of the best in Madrid. We were....

name: Pimiento Verde
address: Calle de Quintana, 1, 28008 Madrid, Spain
review: The food was so good, I'm going back tomorrow. I had 2/2 order of the flowered artichokes, 2/2 order croquettes, roasted peppers with tuna. I'll go back for.... Very good food, great service. I've been here twice and no disappointment. Give this restaurant a try!. I don't know the hours of this establishment but it was open for lunch and dinner early enough for people who don't want to wait until 730 or 830 for a....

name: The Little Big Café
description: Breakfast & Brunch Coffee & Tea Juice Bars & Smoothies
address: Calle de Fernández de los Ríos, 61, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review: Lovely café with free wifi (just ask for password). Small capacity but not always full. Great array of items on menu. Good coffee. This is the first iced.... The Little Big Café is my favorite brunch and coffee place in Madrid so far. The staff is so friendly and there are a wide variety of options to pick from.... We went to Little Big Café on a Saturday around noon, and were lucky enough to snag a table outside. We ended up deciding on the brunch special, which cost....

name: La Mayor
description: Wine Bars Tapas Bars Beer Bar
address: Calle Mayor, 77, 28013 Madrid, Spain
review: They serve the best seafood paella I ever had in Madrid. The rice is rich cooked with seafood stock and they were very generous with their assortment of.... Couldn't be happier with the service at this restaurant. It is a quaint little spot close to the palace. Our server was extremely nice and very.... overall pretty satisfied with all our dishes. the flavor of the paella was nothing special but pretty good. the ham and cheese plate portion size was pretty....

name: Casa Paco
address: Calle de Altamirano, 38, 28008 Madrid, Spain
review:
Amazing omelettes/Spanish tortillas! Had to order more as soon as I had my first bite. My god it may be the best eggs I've ever had. We got espanola,.... Very good bar for an Aperitivo.
I had a Tortilla with Salmon and Roquefort cheese which was very good. They have many different types of tortillas all for.... The best tortilla in Madrid!!! Small but friendly restaurant. I can talk about all the good food in the restaurant, but the tortilla is a must!!!.

name: Federal
address: Plaza de las Comendadoras, 9, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review: I was looking for a place to eat breakfast that have vegan options and I'm so happy I found this place the house was very polite. They spoke English very.... Hands down one of the best places we visited in Madrid. We are so grateful that we stumbled on this place. Located around la Plaza de las Comendadoras, it.... Finally a great coffee spot with specialty coffee !!! I've been looking all over for an oat milk cappuccino that is bold in flavor. Took a nice walk to this....

name: Casa Mingo
address: Paseo de la Florida, 34, 28008 Madrid, Spain
review: This was the very best meal I had during my trip to Madrid. This is an old restaurant from the 1800s and their speciality is chicken and cider. It is a.... Spectacular food, perfect cider, amazing service. What else do you want? The perfect place for a family meal.. How can anyone rate casa mingo less than 5 stars? It's next to the church where Francisco Goya is interred. And it's been a local mainstay since the 1800's.....

name: El Mini Bar
address: Calle del Mesón de Paños, 1, 28013 Madrid, Spain
review: This place was just amazing! Did a search of our area for tapas restaurants and this one showed as highly rated. The place was busy when we got there and.... We had a reservation and had to wait maybe 10-15 minutes, which was fine. It was such a fun vibe, small inside but very chill and exciting. Good service and.... The best tapas my family had in Madrid! The staff is super friendly and accommodating.  It gets crowded during the typical dinner hours so we would go a....

name: The Toast
address: Calle de Fernando el Católico, 50, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review:
I love it! I visited twice on my five days vacation in Madrid and even though we had to walk quiet a bit - it was worth it.

Especially second time was.... When you first walk into this restaurant, you see a very cute, cozy space with a small bar and some unique/indie decorations throughout. My girlfriend and I.... Best breakfast we had in Madrid.  Friendly, Fast, & clean, so happy to have discovered this restaurant on our last day. We had the breakfast burrito &....

name: Café Mür
address: Plaza Cristino Martos, 2, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review: People in Madrid love carrot cake (tarta de zanahoria) and Cafe Mur is THE place to go for carrot cake. Unless you have the appetite of Mike Tyson, plan on.... Awesome service and delicious food! It's easy to find and I ordered the pancakes, café con leche, and a freshly squeezed natural juice . Everything was.... Just another day eating brunch at Martha Stewart's Madrid home.  What is that you say? Martha Stewart doesn't have a home in Madrid?  Well by the looks of....

name: Algarabía
address: Calle de la Unión, 8, 28013 Madrid, Spain
review: Words can't accurately describe the food served at this place. Once you've eaten here all other food in all of Spain will seem tasteless. Highly recommend.... My husband and I made a reservation and had dinner at this place during our honeymoon in Madrid, and I am SO glad I did. They even sprinkled little glitter.... Cocina típica de la zona de La Rioja, los espárragos trigueros fueron de otro mundo y las setas con puerros fueron increíbles.  De postre el chocolate de....

name: Cafetería HD
address: Calle de Guzmán el Bueno, 67, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review:
Classy old school joint lush with retro details--all it needs is Dean Martin. The sunny side egg on my burger was cooked so perfectly that with the juicy.... So this is exactly how you adjust yourself to the new era!! 
This place is a traditional bar which has been able to change according to costumes.... This place never grabbed my attention from the outside, but once I found out it came from Grupo La Musa, I decided to give it a try when I was in the mood....

name: Tierra
address: Calle de Guzmán el Bueno, 52, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review:
Tried my first ever burrito here and I keep coming back! One of my favorite places to eat. 

I usually get everything on my chicken burrito so I always.... This is the Spanish version of Chipotle in the USA.
Chaotic during lunch time and no seats at this location. The food was flavorless but I'm sure healthier.... So grateful for this little place. Delicious Mexican food, at a good price and chipotle-like ease with ordering. The ingredients are all delicious, and....

name: Massart
address: Calle de Isaac Peral, 2, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review: I randomly walked in Massart not knowing what to expect. The ambiance is really nice, and it has an incredible vibe. We had the burrata and croquetas for.... Really good food for the price and the service was excellent. The inside is also well decorated and a good balance between modern and fancy. Good for.... This was excellent! My three friends and I were on a budget and we got an amazing meal for a low price. For ~20 euros I got a personal pizza and a well....

name: Taste Gallery
address: Plaza San Miguel, 8, 28005 Madrid, Spain
review: Great experience! The staff was very responsive. The chef came out to ask how the food was. The potatoes brevas were amazing. The chimichurri beef was.... Located right next to Mercado de San Miguel.  Great place to sit down and people watch.  I liked the fact that tapas were comparable to the market but.... Located in the Palacio area of Madrid is this cute and reasonably priced restaurant to get your fill of tapas and sangria. It was hands-down one of the best....

name: El Chaparrito
address: Calle Mayor, 68, 28013 Madrid, Spain
review:
Never did I ever think I would have the tacos and margaritas of a lifetime in Spain but I did! The staff is amazing, chef deserves an award and the ambiance.... Delicious, authentic tacos for €1.  Been traveling for 2 weeks in EU.  Coming from Paris, I very much prefer the food in Spain.  Tired of eating crepes,.... Good Mexican food in Spain.
A Yelp reward for  "$10 off" popped up when I checked in. The server claimed that it was not the right location even though my....

name: Don Oso
address: Calle de Donoso Cortés, 90, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review: The service is fast smooth and the burger is made fresh. Nothing too special or out of the ordinary I'd rate the burger as average but it's a great place....

name: Amicis
address: Plaza del Conde de Miranda, 4, 28005 Madrid, Spain
review: What a great spot by Mercado di San Miguel! I hope that it will get more reviews and nice pictures for the guests to trust their noses and go inside to.... Absolutely fresh, flavorful, delicious food. Accommodating service and all beautifully presented. Ambiance, music, and decor was 5 Star plus.  A must see.... My cousin and I stopped in for lunch. He ordered the steak and I ordered the Mexican burger w guac. Both came with their house potatoes. Super yummy! Most....

name: Taberna Origen
address: Calle Juan Álvarez Mendizábal,  44, 28008 Madrid, Spain
review:
Mama Mia. 
Tapas but with a lovable hipster multicultural spin. 
Asian influenced and fresh ingredients. 
Your tongue will throw a party for your mouth.. Excellent tapas and very friendly staff. The smoked sardines were my favourite. We als had tuna tartare, steak tartare, croquetas of shrimp and patatas. All.... This is definitely a hidden gem of Madrid. Great food with a small touch of Asian fusion, but at the same time is so Spanish. The chief did a wonderful job....

name: Vietnam Mekong
address: Calle de Isabel la Católica, 11, 28013 Madrid, Spain
review: Food: The pho was delicious and flavorful prior to 'doctoring up'. The rollitos were perfectly cooked as well. They were not soggy, they were quite crispy.... OK, I admit it, we had a terrific dinner and hangout with great Spanish food and then two of us just said, heck but we want Pho! So off to look around we.... Very simple but good pho. Would've preferred to have tendon and tripe in my bowl but it was just steak. Didn't come with any bean sprouts. Service was very....

name: Las Carboneras
address: Plaza del Conde de Miranda, 1, 28005 Madrid, Spain
review:
This was my first flamenco experience and it was amazing. I get it, I have nothing else to compare it to but the flamenco aficionados I accompanied verified.... A flamenco bar that served a very limited variety of tapas.
Each table had a pitcher of cold sangria which was enjoyable but a tad sweet, also red wine.
The.... Our group had a wonderful time! The dancers are lively and engaging. Having drinks and tapas while enjoying Flamenco is a great way to spend an evening in....

name: Taberna Rayuela
address: Calle de la Morería, 8, 28005 Madrid, Spain
review:
Excelent menu. Great prices. Staff is ready to help you with your queries. 
Full lunch/ light lunch / tapas. Wonderful food and wonderful service. Give this restaurant a try and you will not be disappointed!Seems small but it's actually very cozy atmosphere.. The service and place were fine, but the food was below average for the area.  We only tried the tapas, maybe the mains are better..

name: El Anciano Rey de los Vinos
address: Calle de Bailén, 19, 28013 Madrid, Spain
review: Great food and service, huge portions. Sangria and beer are good. Great atmosphere and good to sit outside.. Went here on a tapas tour with Devour Tours and got to try the bulls balls! So good I forgot to take a photo of the tapas. They had a very good wine.... Food and drinks for a breakfast before touring the Royal Palace.  Very pleasantly surprised with the quality of food and service in such a touristy....

name: Con 2 Fogones
address: Calle de San Bernardino, 9, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review: On my last day in Madrid after spending time at the Templo de Debod, I was looking for a decent sit-down place for lunch. I found Con 2 Fogones nearby with.... This place has more than tapa.. In other word, they serve food in bigger portion size at around 10 euro, which is great if you are doing a budget travel. I.... This place is a cozy restaurant that you can go to have an intimate lunch or dinner or a place you can go to have a meal with your friends. The atmosphere....

name: El Jardín Secreto
address: Calle de Conde Duque, 2, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review:
Cute girls night / date type of place


Came here with two friends for drinks and a little dessert--- great menus for both. Fun Alice and Wonderland vibes.... Positives: Really quirky cute eatery with interesting decor that ranges from romantic to exotic animal. There are lots of different seating options that.... Great place. Ambiance is super cool. Love the fact that is inside the store. Food was amazing. I ordered the tikka masala chicken was delicious! The drinks....

name: Camoatí
address: Calle de Alfonso VI, 3, 28005 Madrid, Spain
review: I almost didn't come in because the place looked like a tiny bar... SO glad I did. Restaurant in the back is beautiful, charming, cozy, and serves delicious.... Went here by recommendation from a friend - hands down the best meal we had in Madrid ! Amazing atmosphere, service and food - we wish we could go here.... In Madrid de los Austrias, the neighborhood that roughly extends from the Royal Palace to the Plaza Mayor there are streets packed with restaurants for....

name: Café de Oriente
address: Plaza de Oriente, 2, 28013 Madrid, Spain
review:
If you're lucky sit outside and enjoy the famous Spanish gin and tonic.  they use it with I tried to slice of apple. We did not use tonic we used a special.... Best meal of our trip, and we've been to Lisbon, Sintra, Nice, Monaco, and now Madrid.

Highly recommend: croquettes (come with 3 different types, cod, ham,.... We stopped by this cute cafe before we headed to the royal palace. When we walked in I really like the decor of the place! There was a mixture of tables and....

name: La Chalana
address: Calle de San Leonardo, 12, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review: Great restaurant to eat seafood.  Went with a small group of 6 and everyone was very happy with the food. I had the sea bass and it was excellent as was the.... Very delicious！We came here in the afternoon but it's a long line and takes an hour to wait so we decide to make reservation and have dinner. It's a good.... If you are in the area this is a good option for seafood and the Cachopo is very good! I tried for the first time but I'd go back for it.

name: La Taqueria del Alamillo
address: Plaza del Alamillo, 8, 28005 Madrid, Spain
review:
Best mexican I have seen in my extensive world travels. No trip to Madrid is complete without a visit here.

The Tamarinde marguerita is amazing.. This food has been by far the best Mexican food that we have had even better than restaurants that we have been to in the United States. The food came out.... Very nice getaway from Tapas.  
A little taste of Mexico.  
Not like LA Mexican or even Mexico Mexican, but very good. (Especially when you're all tapassed....

name: Alcaravea
address: Calle de Gaztambide, 56, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review: This is the best meal I've had since arriving in Madrid two months ago! Incredible food, great service, and very reasonable prices. Each dish is perfect and.... Food was delicious one of the best fish I ever had! We went for lunch with family. 5star food as well as service. Owner and manager super friendly. Huge.... This place is fantastic.  I was near Moncloa and don't normally go out to eat, so  for one of the few times I did go out, I didn't want to end up in some....

name: El Invernadero de SB
description: Breakfast & Brunch Juice Bars & Smoothies Gastropubs
address: Calle Gran Vía, 65, 28013 Madrid, Spain
review:
A mostly vegetarian 1-star Michelin Tasting Menu!

We did a YouTube review - https://youtu.be/RjmVqE8E2eo

Firstly, come here hungry, we left stuffed!! I.... We loved the crazy cocktails!! The service and food were also awesome. Highly recommend!. The space is probably 4-5 star, very instagrammable and cute,  filled with faux and real greens. 

Cocktails were WAY TOO SWEET and not drinkable. Are you....

name: Casa Mono
address: Calle de Tutor, 37, 28008 Madrid, Spain
review: Came for a group dinner. Good service, and all the dishes in the pre-fix menu were pretty good. Particularly the ravioli of lamb tajin and Galician sirloin. Fabulous. Excellent service, creative dishes. Ordered many dishes and was very happy.  The artichoke salad is memorable.  The foie gras extremely rich and.... Yes I came back to Madrid to have this delicious burger again. The first time I came to Casa Mono was 5/2018. I had to come back for their delicious Casa....

name: El Triángulo de las Verduras
address: Calle de Antillón, 1, 28011 Madrid, Spain
review: Great location for vegans/vegetarians but non veggies will enjoy the wide arrange of food. We tried the hamburgeusa, crocquets, empanadas, pizza, and their.... This a is pretty special place and needs explanation. Not everyone enjoys the authentic de barrio feeling of this tavern. Leave outside your expectations.... Indulgent vegan food for dinner. Their burgers are outstanding. They also have nicely conceived ajvar and empanadas. The place itself is tiny but well....

name: Casa Lafu
address: Calle de la Flor Baja, 1, 28013 Madrid, Spain
review: We fancied Chinese food for dinner and Casa Lafu was a place I had researched in advance and thought good which was also near Gran Via where we were.... Sour fish are fresh and delicious. Soy souce onion garlic steamed scallops are so good and fresh.  So grade to have hollow Vegi in here and satisfied my.... My family all wanted Chinese for lunch, but I am not a fan of Chinese food, as most restaurants I have been to in the U.S. are mediocre. I am so glad I....

name: Seoul
address: Ronda de Segovia, 25, 28005 Madrid, Spain
review: This place is GOOD! The food is delicious and very Korean. Location is near the Royal Palace but a little bit tricky to walk to. The exact location on Yelp.... The first time that I feel the certification means nothing! Bad service attitude and terrible tastes. Also you can see the food residue on the plate. I ask.... Food: We had the pork belly, korean bbq beef, udon noodles, and bibimbap. While nothing was bad it was lacking in flavor. The bibimbap needed a little extra....

name: Entrevinos
address: Calle de Ferraz, 36, 28008 Madrid, Spain
review: Very much a "hole in the wall", but very inviting, and a family atmosphere inside. Gentle chatter of multi-generational group at one table, older (50's?.... A better bar than restaurant.   We had the steak in a gorgonzola tomato sauce that was the best of our dishes.  Also had a foie gras with a mango chutney.... Entrevinos deserves a lot of praise. It's an informal place which to all appearances has little to offer, in a slightly out-of-the way location, but it has....

name: El Urogallo
address: Paseo de la Puerta del Ángel, s/n, 28011 Madrid, Spain
review: We visited this restaurant after swimming in the public pool. You can sit outside under big parasols. We ordered a steak, lamb ribs and fish (photo). The.... Amazing food and very nice & friendly staff (especially Manuel and Roger). Absolute worth visiting !!!.

name: Platos Rotos
address: Calle de Ferraz, 39, 28008 Madrid, Spain
review:
Aquí son super amables, la comida es casera, sabrosa y super barata! Si tomas algo de beber te pondrán tapas enormes!
Además de los platos típicos tienen....

name: Nakeima
address: Calle de Meléndez Valdés, 54, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review:
Super cool place to eat. Didn't realize it was OMAKASE style but it was definitely fun. The staff were super nice and attentive. The food were really good..... This is what Japanese food tastes like in hell.

The only meal I've ever paid for which made me GAG midway through. (The culprit: A "shrimp cocktail".... There's no menu, just go with whatever the server/chef recommends, you won't be disappointed. Dumplings were unique and flavorful, not average dim sum.....

name: La Taberna del Alabardero
address: Calle Felipe V, 6, 28013 Madrid, Spain
review: When in Madrid, do as the Spaniards would do.  In Spain there are many complaints of slow service, however that is a standard and should not be considered.... Excellent food, must try their croquettes. Excellent service we had Alfonso he was amazing. Would go back, and suggest for everyone to go.. Not impressed. Considering the competition they have in Madrid you would think they would step it up but I guess their success is that it is a tourist trap....

name: La Cajita de Nori
address: Calle del Limón, 30, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review: There are so many gems in this neighborhood but this one stands out as the best.  The terrace/outside eating area  is next to a little park across from the.... We enjoyed this restaurant very much. It's very small but they have they whole plaza ( outdoor sidewalk plaza) with tables and that was just great. The.... We loved this place! We stayed around the corner and were looking for tapas late on a Wednesday night. We ate outside, enjoyed the locals, and didn't have a....

name: La Bola
address: Calle de la Bola, 5, 28013 Madrid, Spain
review: Anyone who gives this place less than 4.5 stars is sorely mistaken! Admittedly we were skeptical after reading some not so great reviews but so glad we.... La Bola is a classic tavern in the Austrias district of Madrid.  150+ years La Bola has been serving Madrid.  Their Cocida a la Madrileña is amazing..... Took two days to get in this place and they really only serve one thing. Big jar cooked all night with garbanzos , Ox tail, and potatoes. The all night cook....

name: Pimiento Verde
address: Calle Conde de Miranda, 4, 28005 Madrid, Spain
review: El servicio es bueno, pero el dueño del restaurante es un maleducado y un grosero, la comida es muy salada, excesivamente. Te sirven alcachofas, pero de lata.. I'll be darned if this wasn't the best artichoke I've ever eaten! Holy moly that was delicious. The wine was great too, as was the risotto we split, but wow.... Came here after visiting the Royal Palace. One of few places to stay open during siesta hour. Also prices may appear high, but portions are quite large....

name: Rey de Tallarines
address: Calle de San Bernardino, 2, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review: This restaurant doesn't look Chinese at all. But what they do inside is closer to authenticity than every other Chinese restaurant I've tried so far. One.... I cannot remember everything that I ate at Rey de Tallarines, but I definitely remember being satisfied with everything I had. The decor is pretty basic and.... Rey de Tallarines is located in the center of Madrid, near Plaza de Espana. It has been rated very highly for Asian food on Yelp and i decided to massage my....

name: Restaurante Manolo 1934
address: Calle Princesa, 83, 28008 Madrid, Spain
review:
I came here for lunch but I decided to go for the Menú Rabo de Toro instead of the daily menu as the restaurant took part in the Mes del Rabo de Toro.... Authentic Spanish  cuisine ! 
Try tapas n deserts! 
Amazing experience !
Friends who has been living in Madrid for over 20
Years - Brought us here to have.... This place is awesome. I have been here many times for morning coffee and delicious tortilla de patatas. I have also been here for their tapas. They offer a....

name: Ene
address: Calle del Nuncio,19, 28005 Madrid, Spain
review:
Very good food, especially the ceviche and the tomato soup.
They have the best gin tonics in town. Definitely the most extensive gin menu. And the way they.... Ene is a lounge that reminded me of a place I went to in New York City - it's swanky, modern, and "pijo". A group of about 9 of us went there for a Sunday....

name: Crumb
address: Calle Conde Duque, 8, 28015 Madrid, Spain
review:
Great, creative sandwiches! The veggie was phenomenal--I'm trying to figure out if I can recreate it at home. Love the use of sweet potato! 

Also, friendly.... If you're the kinda person who eats mayo out of a jar, or likes to slap people with slimy roast beef, eat at Crumb

On the bright side their soup was good..... So nice and cute place with great sandwiches!! I choose the one with goat cheese and it was amazing... I like to explore small places with soul and this is....
